mypackage

Class StandardInputRead

  • java.lang.Object
    • mypackage.StandardInputRead

  • public class StandardInputRead
extends java.lang.Object
    It reads input from the standard input hiding from the user the usage of java.io package classes

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int NEG_ERROR
      The error that is return when reading negative integers from stdin
      static int POS_ERROR
      The error that is return when reading positive integers from stdin

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Date readDate(java.lang.String message)
      It reads an date in the form dd/mm/yyyy from standard input and returns it as value.In case of an error it returns null
      float readNegativeFloat(java.lang.String message)
      It reads an negative float from standard input and returns it as value.
      int readNegativeInt(java.lang.String message)
      It reads an negative integer from standard input and returns it as value.
      float readPositiveFloat(java.lang.String message)
      It reads an positive float, zero included, from standard input and returns it as value.
      int readPositiveInt(java.lang.String message)
      It reads an positive integer, zero included, from standard input and returns it as value.
      java.lang.String readString(java.lang.String message)
      It reads a string from standard inputand returns it as value.
      java.util.Date readTime(java.lang.String message)
      It reads an time in the form h:mm AM or PM from standard input and returns it as value.In case of an error it returns null Example of valid times: 8:30 AM, 2:00 PM, etc

        public java.lang.String readString(java.lang.String message)
        It reads a string from standard inputand returns it as value. In case of an error it returns null
        Parameters:
        message - The message that is apperad to the user asking for input

      • readPositiveInt

        public int readPositiveInt(java.lang.String message)
        It reads an positive integer, zero included, from standard input and returns it as value. In case of an error it returns -1
        Parameters:
        message - The message that is apperad to the user asking for input

      • readNegativeInt

        public int readNegativeInt(java.lang.String message)
        It reads an negative integer from standard input and returns it as value. In case of an error it returns 1
        Parameters:
        message - The message that is apperad to the user asking for input

      • readPositiveFloat

        public float readPositiveFloat(java.lang.String message)
        It reads an positive float, zero included, from standard input and returns it as value. In case of an error it returns -1.0
        Parameters:
        message - The message that is apperad to the user asking for input
